author: paige_splash
description: I got ink! My mom and dad got the same ink on the other wrist. Also, while freshman year at college was tough - I was tougher. Clearly. Because I have ink. Which makes me tough. Grrr.

author: paige_splash
description: I graduated University of Nebraska High School Class of 2023. Family and friends participated both in-person and virtual via a live stream. We had Spaghetti Works for dinner.

author: paige_splash
description: When one goes to prom, one puts on all the fanciness. Including ones fancy new glasses.

author: paige_splash
description: Through the tail-end of my high school education, a pandemic changed the world forever. I did my part, wore a mask, and socially distanced when possible. Thankfully my mom is super-crafty and made masks for us all. Still caught Covid.

author: paige_splash
description: You see that warning sign on the edge of the ski slope? I did. And I ran right into it resulting in a crushed vertebrae.

author: paige_splash
description: There are worse things than being attacked by balls of yarn. BALLS. OF. YARN. ðŸ˜±

author: paige_splash
description: I say, dear Watson, is that you in London? Why yes, yes it is. Other European countries I have visited include Spain, Germany, Italy, France, and Sweden.

author: paige_splash
description: Cruising has taken me to Mexico, Jamaica, Nicaragua, and here in Belize. On this partiular trip we rented a helicopter to go see the Great Blue Hole from the air. I did not fly the helicopter.

author: paige_splash
description: At some point, I developed a penchant for all things bright and neon. Don't judge me.

author: paige_splash
description: Can you fly? I can. At least in a tube with fast moving air. Someday, maybe, I will skydive for realz. This was my "peace and pouty" phase.

author: paige_splash
description: Everybody seems to remember the start of my taekwondo journey differently. I stayed with it right up to college, earning my fourth-degree black belt. Here is my very first black belt with Mr. Trent Quinn.

author: paige_splash
description: The tongue. Always with the tongue. From day one.

author: paige_splash
description: I was not always homeschooled. It was just a better way of learning for me. Here I am before a walk-a-thon at school. Don't ask to see the after photo. I was hot, sweaty, tired, and in none too good of a mood.

author: paige_splash
description: So there I was in Mexico. Taking down my cartel competition. Okay, not really. On the Pacific side of Mexico, I spent the week swimming - including with dolphins. They were kind of scary.
